post_text: Last year we started a new tradition at Milnor Elementary: The Bulldog Award. The Bulldog Award is a yearly award give to one elementary student that excels in a number of ways. This student must be a role model; be honest and caring; be a vocal leader, and show integrity and courage. As you can see the award is focused on students that choose to do the right things without being prompted, asked, or told. Students that are considered not only stand up for themselves but stand up for other students when wrongs are being done. It's an award that the teachers in Milnor take very seriously and one that the staff ensures goes to the right student. This years winner is Leah Buskohl. I could say a million great things about Leah, but I'll let a few of her teachers do that for me. Leah will have her name engraved on the plaque outside of Mr. Weber's office and her picture put on the plaque for the entirety of next school year. Congratulations Leah. It's a well deserved honor!

2020 MILNOR SCHOOL BOARD ELECTIONS

The 2020 Milnor School Board election will be held on Tuesday, June 9, at the Milnor Public School with polls open from 11:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The purpose of the election is to elect two board members to 3-year terms.

Both candidates will be from Area 2, representing the rural school district (excluding the Township of Milnor and the City of Milnor).

Kate Mund and Kari Wehlander terms are up for election for Area 2.

Anyone wishing to run for the position and have their name on the ballot must file a School Board Application form and a Statement of Interest form. These forms are available at the Milnor Public School business office, on Milnor Public School’s School Board website or call the Business Manager, Wanda Hogness at 427-5237. Forms must be returned by 4:00 p.m., Monday, April 6, 2020, for your name to be on the official ballot.

Screenagers at the Fargo Theatre

Community members are invited to the screening of Screenagers on Tuesday, October 29 at the Fargo Theatre at 7:00 p.m. Screenagers is an award-winning film that probes into the vulnerable corners of family life and depicts messy struggles over social media, video games and academics. The film offers solutions on how we can help our kids navigate the digital world. The evening consists of screening of the film, followed by a discussion to help families manage and decrease struggles around screen time. This event is free and open to the public. Click on the link in the comments to register.
